rubric.content:
The work of instructional designers can be compared to architects.

To see how, click each number on the path.

main:
{{[0]
}}
{{[1]
}}
{{[2]
}}
{{[3]
}}
{{[4]
}}
@@[0]Architects analyze a client’s needs, a structure’s intended uses, and the environment in which a structure is going to be built.@@ @@[1]Architects use their understanding of engineering, aesthetics, and human psychology to design a building that will stand and serve its inhabitants.@@ @@[2]Architects use a systematic process to make sure their designs meet all project requirements.@@ @@[3]Architects produce blueprints, which serve as the building’s design. They remain involved during the building’s construction, but do not usually build the building themselves.@@ @@[4]Architects evaluate outcomes to make sure the finished product successfully conveys the project’s design.

Is creativity important? Absolutely! If you give ten architects the same project, you’ll end up with ten different designs. Each design may meet the project’s requirements, but some will be beautiful, imaginative, and inspiring, while others might be merely functional.

Creativity is what makes good instructional design great!@@
